author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Economy’s abstracts at River Arts
text:
Economy’s abstracts at River Arts Oct 05, 2015 Camden artist Mac Economy has a solo show this month at River Arts in Damariscotta. 
Damariscotta — River Arts on Route 1 invites the public to the opening of a solo show in the West Gallery featuring the work of Camden artist Mac Economy Friday, Oct. 9, from 5 to 7 p.m. The show will run through the 21st, concurrent with the juried group show “Views in the Sheepscot Watershed.” 
Economy’s large abstract art in acrylic and mixed media focuses on deep texture with strong color contrasts. The Midcoast native is a professional musician and guitar instructor who operates K2 Music in Camden. Over the past few years, he has been showing his abstracts in Midcoast galleries and businesses and is gaining momentum in the art community. For more information about his work, visit maceconomyart.com . 
River Arts is located at 241 Route 1, just north of N.C. Hunt Lumber, and is open Tuesdays through Saturdays from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; and Sundays from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. 
 4401, ext. 115;
